item.title: Introduction to Spring Framework 6 HTTP interfaces
item.description: Introduction The Spring Framework version 6, along with (Spring Boot version 3) will introduce the ability to consume HTTP apis in a declarative way using interfaces. This feature resembles the Spring Data way of writing repositories, where we just create an interface and declare what methods it should have and Spring Data will create a proxy, implementing all SQL queries. It’s worth pointing out that Spring Framework 6 is still in the snapshot state and the current article reflects the state of the things as they are in June 2022.
